de.awi.floenavigation.helperclasses

Class DatabaseHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
      • de.awi.floenavigation.helperclasses.DatabaseHelper

  • public class DatabaseHelper
extends android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
    This class provides the methods necessary to Setup and Maintain the SQLiteDatabase of the App. This is the most important class in the App. When the App is installed on a tablet this Class creates and sets up the Database schema and inserts default values in specific tables. The rest of the Activities and Background Services use this class to access the database and update any values if required.
    See Also:
    SQLiteDatabase, SQLiteOpenHelper

      • DB_VERSION

        private static final int DB_VERSION
        The current version of this Database. This needs to be updated with every new version of the App which changes the Database Schema. This is used by the onUpgrade(SQLiteDatabase, int, int) function to check if the Database needs to updated when the App is installed.
        See Also:

      • firstStationIndex

        public static final int firstStationIndex
        Index value for the Origin of Floe's Coordinate System. This index value is used in different classes and activities whenever an array of Station parameters (such as MMSIs or Latitude/Longitudes) is created this will be the index in the array at which the values for the Origin station will be found.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • secondStationIndex

        public static final int secondStationIndex
        Index value for the x-Axis Marker of Floe's Coordinate System. This index value is used in different classes and activities whenever an an array of Station parameters (such as MMSIs or Latitude/Longitudes) is created this will be the index in the array at which the values for the x-Axis Marker station will be found.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LATITUDE_INDEX

        public static final int LATITUDE_INDEX
        Index value for Latitude in an array of {Latitude, Longitude}. Currently all coordinates in the App are created in an array such that the Latitude is at this index value.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LONGITUDE_INDEX

        public static final int LONGITUDE_INDEX
        Index value for Longitude in an array of {Latitude, Longitude}. Currently all coordinates in the App are created in an array such that the Longitude is at this index value.

      • INITIALIZATION_SIZE

        public static final int INITIALIZATION_SIZE
        Specifies the number of base stations which will be used to create the Floe's coordinate system. This is used extensively by SetupActivity and other activities as well to initialize its arrays to the correct size.

      • NUM_OF_BASE_STATIONS

        public static final int NUM_OF_BASE_STATIONS
        Similar to INITIALIZATION_SIZE. Specifies the minimum number of base/fixed station which can be used to maintain the Grid. This is used in RecoveryActivity to check if sufficient number of Fixed/Base Stations are left. This is also used for updating the ActionBar icon for Grid Setup.

        public static final double ORIGIN_DISTANCE

      • error_threshold

        public static final java.lang.String error_threshold
        Name of the Configuration Parameter which defines the maximum correct distance in meters between the predicted coordinates and received coordinates for a Fixed Station. If the distance between the predicted coordinates and received coordinates is above the value specified by this Configuration Parameter it will be considered as an incorrect Prediction.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • prediction_accuracy_threshold

        public static final java.lang.String prediction_accuracy_threshold
        Name of the Configuration Parameter which defines the minimum time during which if three incorrect prediction occurs for a Fixed Station it will be considered to be broken from the Floe. Used extensively by ValidationService.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • lat_long_view_format

        public static final java.lang.String lat_long_view_format
        Name of the Configuration Parameter which sets the display format for Latitude and Longitude on the App interface. It can either be only degree with decimal values (Degree.xxxx) or Degrees Minutes Seconds with Direction (Degree Minutes' Seconds'' Direction).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • decimal_number_significant_figures

        public static final java.lang.String decimal_number_significant_figures
        Name of the Configuration Parameter which set the number of significant figures to show for any decimal field to show on the interface of the App. Please note this only defines it for displaying purposes, the calculations in the App use the complete Double data type length.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • sync_server_hostname

      • sync_server_port

        public static final java.lang.String sync_server_port
        Name of the Configuration Parameter whose value gives the Port on the Synchronization Server with which the App will try to synchronize its data with in SyncActivity.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • fixedStationTable

        public static final java.lang.String fixedStationTable
        Table which stores the details of every Fixed Station deployed on the Floe. It stores the location parameters of each Fixed Station and is used to create the Coordinate System of the Floe. It is one of most tables in the Database and should be maintained properly. For each Fixed Station the details being stored are the distance from origin, the angle Alpha from x-Axis of the Floe's coordinate system, the x and y coordinates in the Floe's Coordinate system and the received and predicted coordinates in Latitude and Longitude. This table is also used to predict and validate each Fixed Station and to detect if a station has broken from the Floe. Data from this table is displayed on the Grid.

        This table is synchronized with Synchronization Server during SyncActivity. This table's data pushed to the Sync Server, and its local copy is cleared after which the new data is pulled from the Synchronization Server.

        For more details check the Database Schema.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • stationListTable

        public static final java.lang.String stationListTable
        Table which stores a list of names and MMSIs of Fixed Stations. The AISDecodingService checks the MMSI for each decoded AIS message in this table and if the MMSI exists in this table that means that the AIS message is from a Fixed Station and then the actual data received in the AIS message is inserted in the table fixedStationTable.

        This table is synchronized with Synchronization Server during SyncActivity. This table's data pushed to the Sync Server, and its local copy is cleared after which the new data is pulled from the Synchronization Server and populated in this table.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • mobileStationTable

        public static final java.lang.String mobileStationTable
        This table stores the parameters of Mobile Stations. If the AISDecodingService does not find the MMSI from a decoded AIS message in the stationListTable it will insert the data received in the AIS message in this table. The AlphaCalculationService then calculates the position of each station in this table with in the Floe's Coordinate system. Data from this table is displayed on the Grid.

        This table is not synchronized with Synchronization Server during SyncActivity.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • usersTable

        public static final java.lang.String usersTable
        Table name for the Database table which stores a list of Administrative Users of the App and their passwords. Only Users who exist in this table have access to the Admin activities of the App.

        This table is synchronized with Synchronization Server during SyncActivity. This table's data pushed to the Sync Server, and its local copy is cleared after which the new data is pulled from the Synchronization Server and populated in this table.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • sampleMeasurementTable

        public static final java.lang.String sampleMeasurementTable
        Table name for the Database table which stores the Sample/Measurements taken from this tablet. During SampleMeasurementActivity activity when a new Sample is taken its location parameters and other important information is stored in this table along with the label of Sample/Measurement which is then Synchronized with Synchronization Server.

        This table is synchronized with Synchronization Server during SyncActivity. This table's data pushed to the Sync Server, and its local copy is cleared. Data from the Synchronization Server is not pulled for this table.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • deviceListTable

        public static final java.lang.String deviceListTable
        Table name for the Database table which stores the Devices with which Sample/Measurement are taken. This table is empty when App is used for the first time and it is populated during the Synchronization process with the data imported from the D-Ship Server. This table contains the name, shortname, type and unique Device ID of the devices. The data from this table is read and populated in the fields in the SampleMeasurementActivity. Data from this table is not displayed on the Grid.

        This table is synchronized with Synchronization Server during SyncActivity. This table's data is not pushed to the Sync Server, however, its local copy is cleared after which the new data is pulled from the Synchronization Server and populated in this table.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • waypointsTable

        public static final java.lang.String waypointsTable
        Table name for the Database table which stores the Waypoints created from this tablet. A waypoint can be any point of interest on the Ice Floe where a User may want to return to or a User may want to avoid. A series of waypoints can also create a track on the ice. During WaypointActivity activity when a new Waypoint is created its location parameters and other important information is stored in this table along with the label of the Waypoint which is displayed on the Grid. Data from this table is displayed on the Grid.

        This table is synchronized with Synchronization Server during SyncActivity. This table's data pushed to the Sync Server, and its local copy is cleared after which the new data is pulled from the Synchronization Server and populated in this table.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • configParametersTable

        public static final java.lang.String configParametersTable
        Table name for the Database table which stores all the Configuration Parameters names and their values. These Configuration Parameters are used by different Acitivities and Background Services which define the behavior of the App. Details about each Configuration Parameter can be found with the parameter name.

        This table is synchronized with Synchronization Server during SyncActivity, however only some Configuration Parameters are synchronized. The data from the parameters which are synchronized is pushed to the Sync Server, and its local copy is cleared after which the new data is pulled from the Synchronization Server and populated in this table.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • baseStationTable

        public static final java.lang.String baseStationTable
        Table name for the Database table which stores the name and MMSI numbers of the two Fixed Stations (Origin and x-Axis marker) with which the Floe's Coordinate System was created during de.awi.floenavigation.initialsetup. The MMSIs of these two are stored separately because we can then retrieve the Origin location data from fixedStationTable by checking the MMSI from this table, and it is also used in RecoveryActivity and ValidationService as the rows for the MMSIs stored in this table should not be deleted completely from the fixedStationTable else we will not have an Origin.

        This table is synchronized with Synchronization Server during SyncActivity. This table's data pushed to the Sync Server, and its local copy is cleared after which the new data is pulled from the Synchronization Server and populated in this table.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • betaTable

        public static final java.lang.String betaTable
        Table name for the Database table which stores the latest value for the Angle Beta which defines the Floe's Coordinate System with in the Geographical Coordinate System of the world. The value of the angle is calculated and inserted in this table by AngleCalculationService at regular intervals. This value is then used extensively through out the App by different Activities and Background Services.

        This table is synchronized with Synchronization Server during SyncActivity. This table's data pushed to the Sync Server, and its local copy is cleared after which the new data is pulled from the Synchronization Server and populated in this table.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • staticStationListTable

        public static final java.lang.String staticStationListTable
        Table name for the Database table which stores the Static Stations. Static Stations are fixed points on the ice which may be a tent or a hut or as specified by stationTypes like a Fixed Station but these stations do not have an AIS transponder. This table stores the location parameters such as x,y coordinates of the station with in the Floe's Coordinate System which are calculated and inserted in the table by StaticStationFragment. Data from this table is displayed on the Grid.

        This table is synchronized with Synchronization Server during SyncActivity. This table's data pushed to the Sync Server, and its local copy is cleared after which the new data is pulled from the Synchronization Server and populated in this table.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • stationListDeletedTable

        public static final java.lang.String stationListDeletedTable
        Table name for the Database table which stores a list of deleted Fixed Stations. This table contains the MMSIs and deletion time of each Fixed Station which was deleted from this particular instance of the App whether by Recovery Activity or Validation Service. Whenever a Fixed Station is recovered it specific row is deleted from the stationListTable and its MMSI is added to this table. When the Synchronization process is run this table is synchronized with the Sync Server which then deletes the same station from all the other tablets.

        When a Fixed Station is deleted either by Recovery or by Validation Service its entry has to be deleted from two or three different database tables: stationListTable, fixedStationTable and if it is the origin or x-Axis marker then from baseStationTable. This means that when a fixed station is deleted its MMSI should be added to two or three different tables: stationListDeletedTable, fixedStationDeletedTable and in case it is the orign or x-Axis marker baseStationDeletedTable. These deleted tables are then Synchronized with the Sync Server which removes the entries in these tables from its tables and pushes those tables to other instance of the App so that when a fixed station is removed from one tablet it is removed from all tablet.

        This table is synchronized with Synchronization Server during SyncActivity. This table's data pushed to the Sync Server, and its local copy is cleared. No data is pulled from the Sync Server for this table.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • fixedStationDeletedTable

        public static final java.lang.String fixedStationDeletedTable
        Table name for the Database table which stores a list of deleted Fixed Stations. This table contains the MMSIs and deletion time of each Fixed Station which was deleted from this particular instance of the App whether by Recovery Activity or Validation Service. Whenever a Fixed Station is recovered it specific row is deleted from the fixedStationTable and its MMSI is added to this table. When the Synchronization process is run this table is synchronized with the Sync Server which then deletes the same station from all the other tablets.

        When a Fixed Station is deleted either by Recovery or by Validation Service its entry has to be deleted from two or three different database tables: stationListTable, fixedStationTable and if it is the origin or x-Axis marker then from baseStationTable. This means that when a fixed station is deleted its MMSI should be added to two or three different tables: stationListDeletedTable, fixedStationDeletedTable and in case it is the orign or x-Axis marker baseStationDeletedTable. These deleted tables are then Synchronized with the Sync Server which removes the entries in these tables from its tables and pushes those tables to other instance of the App so that when a fixed station is removed from one tablet it is removed from all tablet.

        This table is synchronized with Synchronization Server during SyncActivity. This table's data pushed to the Sync Server, and its local copy is cleared. No data is pulled from the Sync Server for this table.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • staticStationDeletedTable

        public static final java.lang.String staticStationDeletedTable
        Table name for the Database table which stores a list of deleted Static Stations. This table contains the names and deletion time of each Static Station which was deleted from this particular instance of the App. Whenever a Static Station is recovered it specific row is deleted from the staticStationListTable and its name is added to this table. When the Synchronization process is run this table is synchronized with the Sync Server which then deletes the same station from all the other tablets.

        This table is synchronized with Synchronization Server during SyncActivity. This table's data pushed to the Sync Server, and its local copy is cleared. No data is pulled from the Sync Server for this table.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • baseStationDeletedTable

        public static final java.lang.String baseStationDeletedTable
        Table name for the Database table which stores a list of deleted Base Stations (Base Stations are origin and the x-Axis marker). This table contains the MMSIs and deletion time of each Base Station which was deleted from this particular instance of the App whether by Recovery Activity or Validation Service. Whenever a Base Station is recovered it specific row is deleted from the baseStationTable and its MMSI is added to this table. When the Synchronization process is run this table is synchronized with the Sync Server which then deletes the same station from all the other tablets.

        When a Fixed Station is deleted either by Recovery or by Validation Service its entry has to be deleted from two or three different database tables: stationListTable, fixedStationTable and if it is the origin or x-Axis marker then from baseStationTable. This means that when a fixed station is deleted its MMSI should be added to two or three different tables: stationListDeletedTable, fixedStationDeletedTable and in case it is the orign or x-Axis marker baseStationDeletedTable. These deleted tables are then Synchronized with the Sync Server which removes the entries in these tables from its tables and pushes those tables to other instance of the App so that when a fixed station is removed from one tablet it is removed from all tablet.

        This table is synchronized with Synchronization Server during SyncActivity. This table's data pushed to the Sync Server, and its local copy is cleared. No data is pulled from the Sync Server for this table.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • waypointDeletedTable

        public static final java.lang.String waypointDeletedTable
        Table name for the Database table which stores a list of deleted Waypoints. This table contains the names and deletion time of each Waypoint which was deleted from this particular instance of the App. Whenever a Waypoint is deleted its specific row is deleted from the waypointsTable and its name is added to this table. When the Synchronization process is run this table is synchronized with the Sync Server which then deletes the same waypoint from all the other tablets.

        This table is synchronized with Synchronization Server during SyncActivity. This table's data pushed to the Sync Server, and its local copy is cleared. No data is pulled from the Sync Server for this table.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • userDeletedTable

        public static final java.lang.String userDeletedTable
        Table name for the Database table which stores a list of deleted Admin Users. This table contains the names and deletion time of each Admin User which was deleted from this particular instance of the App. Whenever an Admin User is deleted its specific row is deleted from the usersTable and its name is added to this table. When the Synchronization process is run this table is synchronized with the Sync Server which then deletes the same User from all the other tablets.

        This table is synchronized with Synchronization Server during SyncActivity. This table's data pushed to the Sync Server, and its local copy is cleared. No data is pulled from the Sync Server for this table.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • stationName

        public static final java.lang.String stationName
        Column name for an AIS Station name. This column name is used in all tables which maintain any AIS station data, such as Fixed Stations or Mobile Stations. This is a TEXT field.

        A column of this name is present in several database tables such as stationListTable, fixedStationTable, baseStationTable, mobileStationTable and their respective deleted tables if it exists.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • latitude

        public static final java.lang.String latitude
        Column name for storing the Latitude of any point or station. This column name is used in all tables which maintain any geographic data, such as Fixed Stations or Waypoints etc. The data type for this field REAL.

        A column of this name is present in several database tables such as waypointsTable, fixedStationTable, mobileStationTable and sampleMeasurementTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • longitude

        public static final java.lang.String longitude
        Column name for storing the Longitude of any point or station. This column name is used in all tables which maintain any geographic data, such as Fixed Stations or Waypoints etc. The data type for this field REAL.

        A column of this name is present in several database tables such as waypointsTable, fixedStationTable, mobileStationTable and sampleMeasurementTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • recvdLatitude

        public static final java.lang.String recvdLatitude
        Column name for storing the Latitude received from the AIS data of a Fixed Station. This column is used in fixedStationTable where data from this column is compared with data from latitude column by the ValidationService to check if the Fixed Station has broken off. The data type for this field REAL.

        A column of this name is present in the database table fixedStationTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • recvdLongitude

        public static final java.lang.String recvdLongitude
        Column name for storing the Longitude received from the AIS data of a Fixed Station. This column is used in fixedStationTable where data from this column is compared with data from latitude column by the ValidationService to check if the Fixed Station has broken off. The data type for this field REAL.

        A column of this name is present in the database table fixedStationTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • xPosition

        public static final java.lang.String xPosition
        Column name for storing the x coordinates of any point or station in the Floe's Coordinate System. This column name is used in all tables which maintain any location data, such as Fixed Stations or Waypoints etc. Data from this column is used to display the stations/waypoints on the Grid. The data type for this field REAL.

        A column of this name is present in several database tables such as waypointsTable, fixedStationTable, mobileStationTable, staticStationListTable and sampleMeasurementTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • yPosition

        public static final java.lang.String yPosition
        Column name for storing the y coordinates of any point or station in the Floe's Coordinate System. This column name is used in all tables which maintain any location data, such as Fixed Stations or Waypoints etc. Data from this column is used to display the stations/waypoints on the Grid. The data type for this field REAL.

        A column of this name is present in several database tables such as waypointsTable, fixedStationTable, mobileStationTable, staticStationListTable and sampleMeasurementTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • sog

        public static final java.lang.String sog
        Column name for storing the Speed Over Ground of an AIS Station as received by AISDecodingService. This column is used in fixedStationTable where data from this column is used by PredictionService to predict the next position of the Fixed Station. The data type for this field REAL.

        A column of this name is present in the database table fixedStationTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • cog

        public static final java.lang.String cog
        Column name for storing the Course Over Ground of an AIS Station as received by AISDecodingService. This column is used in fixedStationTable where data from this column is used by PredictionService to predict the next position of the Fixed Station. The data type for this field REAL.

        A column of this name is present in the database table fixedStationTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • alpha

        public static final java.lang.String alpha
        Column name storing the Angle Alpha. Alpha is the angle a station/waypoint makes with the x-Axis of the Floe's Coordinate System. It is used to calculate the xPosition and yPosition of a Station or Waypoint. This column is used in any table which maintains any location data. The data type for this field REAL.

        A column of this name is present in the database table fixedStationTable, mobileStationTable and staticStationListTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • beta

        public static final java.lang.String beta
        Column name storing the Angle Beta. Beta is the angle the x-Axis of the Floe's Coordinate System makes with longitudinal axis of the Geographic Coordinate system (The World Coordinate system). This angle defines the Floe's Coordinate System and it is calculated and updated at regular intervals by AngleCalculationService. The data type for this field REAL.

        A column of this name is present in the database table betaTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • packetType

        public static final java.lang.String packetType
        Column name for storing the type of AIS Message received from the AIS Transponder of a Fixed Station. The AIS protocol is made up of several different types of messages and only certain types of messages are used in this App. The data from this column tells whether the last received AIS packet was a Position Report or a Static Data Report. The data type for this field INTEGER.

        A column of this name is present in the database table fixedStationTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • predictionAccuracy

        public static final java.lang.String predictionAccuracy
        Specifies the name for a Column which gives how much accurate the predictions have been for a Fixed Station. This is a NUMERIC field which is incremented by the ValidationService every time the distance between the received coordinates (recvdLatitude, recvdLongitude), and the predicted coordinates (latitude, longitude) exceeds the value specified by error_threshold. If the value in this field goes above a certain value specified by a ratio of prediction_accuracy_threshold with ValidationService.VALIDATION_TIME, and the value in incorrectMessageCount goes above three then that Fixed Station will considered to be broken from the Floe.

        A column of this name is present in the database table fixedStationTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • mmsi

        public static final java.lang.String mmsi
        Column name for storing the MMSI of an AIS Station. MMSI is a unique number associated with each AIS Station. This is an INTEGER field which is used to identify AIS Stations. This column is used in any table which maintains AIS Data.

        A column of this name is present in the database table stationListTable, fixedStationTable, baseStationTable, mobileStationTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • staticStationName

        public static final java.lang.String staticStationName
        This column specifies the unique Station name for a Static Station. This is TEXT field which is used to identify Static Stations.

        A column of this name is present in the database table staticStationListTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • stationType

        public static final java.lang.String stationType
        Specifies the name of a Column which stores the type of a Fixed or Static Station. Fixed and Static Station have a type associated with them. The different types of stations is specified by stationTypes. This is a TEXT field.

        A column of this name is present in the database table fixedStationTable, staticStationListTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • distance

        public static final java.lang.String distance
        Specifies the name of a Column which stores the distance in meters of a station or waypoint from the Origin of the Floe's Coordinate system. This field along with alpha is used to calculate the xPosition and yPosition of a Station or Waypoint. This column is used in any table which maintains any location data. The data type for this field REAL.

        A column of this name is present in the database table fixedStationTable, mobileStationTable and staticStationListTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • deviceType

        public static final java.lang.String deviceType
        Specifies the name of a Column which stores the type of Device. Devices are used to take Sample/Measurements in SampleMeasurementActivity. This is a TEXT field.

        A column of this name is present in the database table deviceListTable and sampleMeasurementTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • updateTime

        public static final java.lang.String updateTime
        Specifies the name of a Column which stores the time when a specific event happened. This field has different meanings in different tables. The column in fixedStationTable and mobileStationTable specify the time at which the last AIS packet was received. The same column in betaTable specifies the time at which the current value of beta was calculated and inserted in the table. This field in sampleMeasurementTable and waypointsTable specify the time at which the sample was taken and the time at which the Waypoint was created respectively. This is a TEXT field

        A column of this name is present in the database table fixedStationTable, mobileStationTable, betaTable, waypointsTable and sampleMeasurementTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • isCalculated

        public static final java.lang.String isCalculated
        Specifies the name of a Column which tells whether the location parameters of a Mobile Station haven been calculated or not. When an AIS Packet is received and decoded by AISDecodingService it checks for the MMSI in stationListTable, if the MMSI is not there it will insert the AIS Data in mobileStationTable. However, the x, y coordinates of the Mobile Station are not calculated immediately so it cannot be displayed on Grid then. When the x,y coordinates of the mobile station are calculated by the AlphaCalculationService it sets the value of this field in the mobileStationTable and only is it displayed by the Grid. This is a NUMERIC field.

        A column of this name is present in the database table mobileStationTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • isPredicted

        public static final java.lang.String isPredicted
        Specifies the name of a Column which tells whether the current values of the Geographic coordinates (latitude, longitude) of a Fixed Station are predicted. When a new packet is received by the AISDecodingService it clears this field and when the PredictionService updates these fields it sets this field. The data type of this field is NUMERIC.

        A column of this name is present in the database table fixedStationTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • incorrectMessageCount

        public static final java.lang.String incorrectMessageCount
        Specifies the name of a Column which gives the count of consecutive incorrect predictions for a Fixed Station. This is an INTEGER field which is incremented by the ValidationService every time the distance between the received coordinates (recvdLatitude, recvdLongitude), and the predicted coordinates (latitude, longitude) exceeds the value specified by error_threshold. If the value in this field goes above three and the value in predictionAccuracy goes above a specific value then that Fixed Station is considered to be broken from the Floe.

        A column of this name is present in the database table fixedStationTable.

        See Also:
        predictionAccuracy, Constant Field Values

      • validationCheckTime

        public static final java.lang.String validationCheckTime
        Column name for storing the time at which ValidationService last checked this particular Fixed Station. The columns incorrectMessageCount and predictionAccuracy are incremented only if the updateTime for a station is later than this time. This is a TEXT field

        A column of this name is present in the database table fixedStationTable.

        See Also:
        predictionAccuracy, incorrectMessageCount, Constant Field Values

      • isLocationReceived

        public static final java.lang.String isLocationReceived
        Column name for a field which is set when an AIS packet is received from a Fixed Station. This is specially useful in deployment of new station. When a new station is deployed in the first step only the name and MMSI of the station are inserted in the fixedStationTable and stationListTable. When the AISDecodingService receives an AIS packet from the new station it will check for the MMSI in stationListTable and then insert the Position Report data in fixedStationTable and set this field to 1 and only then will the deployment of the Fixed Station be complete. The data type for this field is NUMERIC.

        A column of this name is present in the database table fixedStationTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • userName

        public static final java.lang.String userName
        Specifies the Column name for storing the unique Usernames in the usersTable table. This is a TEXT field and is used to identify an Admin User.

        A column of this name is present in the database table usersTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • password

        public static final java.lang.String password
        Specifies the Column name for storing the password for a user in the usersTable table. This is a TEXT field and is used to identify an Admin User.

        A column of this name is present in the database table usersTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • deviceID

        public static final java.lang.String deviceID
        Column name for storing the Unique ID of a Device. This is a Unique Identifier associated with each device, from which Sample/Measurement can be taken, this ID is generated by the D-Ship Server and then imported in the Synchronization process along with other device data. This is a TEXT field and the data from this field is a part of the label generated for eah Sample taken from the App which is then pushed to Synchronization Server and then onwards to the D-Ship Server.

        A column of this name is present in the database table deviceListTable and sampleMeasurementTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • deviceName

        public static final java.lang.String deviceName
        Column name for storing the name of a Device. This is the full name of each device, from which Sample/Measurement can be taken, this is imported from the D-Ship Server in the Synchronization process along with other device data. This is a TEXT field.

        A column of this name is present in the database table deviceListTable and sampleMeasurementTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • deviceShortName

        public static final java.lang.String deviceShortName
        Column name for storing the name of a Device. This is the short name of a device, which is imported from the D-Ship Server in the Synchronization process along with other device data. This field is used to create the AutoCompleteTextView in the layout of the SampleMeasurementActivity and based on the value selected other fields of the Device are populated automatically in the Layout. This is a TEXT field.

        A column of this name is present in the database table deviceListTable and sampleMeasurementTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • operation

        public static final java.lang.String operation
        Column name for storing the operation performed during Sample/Measurement. The data in this field specifies for each Sample/Measurement whether the operation performed was a Sample or a Measurement. This is a TEXT field and the data from this field is a part of the label generated for eah Sample/Measurement taken from the App which is then pushed to Synchronization Server and then onwards to the D-Ship Server.

        A column of this name is present in the database table sampleMeasurementTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • labelID

        public static final java.lang.String labelID
        Column name for storing the text/label associated with each Waypoint or Sample/Measurement. This is a TEXT field which is used to store the Unique Waypoint name or in case of Sample/Measurement a simple Text. The data from this field is a part of the label generated for eah Sample/Measurement taken from the App which is then pushed to Synchronization Server and then onwards to the D-Ship Server.

        A column of this name is present in the database table sampleMeasurementTable and waypointsTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • label

        public static final java.lang.String label
        Column name for storing the complete label generated with in the App for each Waypoint or Sample/Measurement. This is a TEXT field which is generated by the App when a Sample/Measurement is created or when a new Waypoint is created. This field is created by appending specific parameters of the Waypoint or Sample/Measurement in Comma Separated Values (CSV). For a Waypoint the format of the label is: time (UTC), tabletLatitude, tabletLongitude, current x Position, current y position, 0, labelID. For a Sample/Measurement the label is: time (UTC), tabletLatitude, tabletLongitude, current x Position, current y position, labelID, operation, comment, deviceID. The time value is formatted to yyyyMMdd'D'HHmmss.

        A column of this name is present in the database table sampleMeasurementTable and waypointsTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • parameterName

        public static final java.lang.String parameterName
        Column name for storing the name of Configuration Parameters. These Configuration Parameters are used by different Activities and Background Services and their values define the behavior of the App. This is a TEXT field and the data which can be inserted in this field is defined by the array configurationParameters.

        A column of this name is present in the database table configParametersTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • parameterValue

        public static final java.lang.String parameterValue
        Column name for storing the value of a Configuration Parameter. These Configuration Parameters are used by different Activities and Background Services and their values define the behavior of the App. This is a TEXT field.

        A column of this name is present in the database table configParametersTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • isOrigin

        public static final java.lang.String isOrigin
        Column name for storing the flag which indicates which Fixed Station is the Origin station. The Origin Station is the most important station as the distance and alpha parameters for other stations are calculated with respect to the Origin station. This is a NUMERIC field and its value is set 1 for only one station in the baseStationTable during the GridSetupActivity. When the location data for the origin is required the baseStationTable is queried selecting only that station for which this field value is 1. This returns the MMSI of the Origin station and then fixedStationTable can be queried for location data of the origin with its MMSI.

        A column of this name is present in the database table baseStationTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • deleteTime

        public static final java.lang.String deleteTime
        Column name for storing the time at which a given Station (Fixed or Static) or Waypoint was deleted. When a Station or Waypoint is recovered its entry is removed from its given tables and a new entry is inserted in the Deleted tables along with the time of deletion. The deleted tables are then synchronized during the Synchronization Process so that the same station or Waypoint is deleted from all the other tablets. This is a TEXT field.

        A column of this name is present in the database table fixedStationDeletedTable, stationListDeletedTable, staticStationDeletedTable, waypointDeletedTable, userDeletedTable and baseStationDeletedTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • comment

        public static final java.lang.String comment
        Column name for storing the Comment field of a Sample/Measurement. A comment is a free text associated with each Sample/Measurement. This is a TEXT field and the data from this field is a part of the label generated for eah Sample taken from the App which is then pushed to Synchronization Server and then onwards to the D-Ship Server.

        A column of this name is present in the database table sampleMeasurementTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • origin

        public static final java.lang.String origin
        A string specifying the value to insert in the stationName field of the fixedStationTable in case the Origin station is recovered or is broken.

        When any Fixed Station is recovered its entire row in the fixedStationTable is deleted, however for the Origin and the x-Axis the row cannot be deleted as these stations define the angle beta and the parameters for other stations and waypoints and sample/measurements such as alpha and distance are calculated in reference to these stations. So when the Origin or x-Axis marker is recovered their entries are deleted from the stationListTable, however in the fixedStationTable the MMSI and Station Name are replaced with a predefined number and text respectively. The location data for the stations is then updated only by the PredictionService and since their MMSI is removed from stationListTable, no AIS data from their MMSI will be inserted in fixedStationTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • basestn1

        public static final java.lang.String basestn1
        A string specifying the value to insert in the stationName field of the fixedStationTable in case the x-Axis station is recovered or is broken.

        When any Fixed Station is recovered its entire row in the fixedStationTable is deleted, however for the Origin and the x-Axis the row cannot be deleted as these stations define the angle beta and the parameters for other stations and waypoints and sample/measurements such as alpha and distance are calculated in reference to these stations. So when the Origin or x-Axis marker is recovered their entries are deleted from the stationListTable, however in the fixedStationTable the MMSI and Station Name are replaced with a predefined number and text respectively. The location data for the stations is then updated only by the PredictionService and since their MMSI is removed from stationListTable, no AIS data from their MMSI will be inserted in fixedStationTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • station1InitialX

        public static final long station1InitialX
        Default value of x coordinate to insert in Database when deploying the Origin during Grid Initial Configuration. As it is the Origin its x,y are {0,0}
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • station1InitialY

        public static final long station1InitialY
        Default value of y coordinate to insert in Database when deploying the Origin during Grid Initial Configuration. As it is the Origin its x,y are {0,0}
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • station2InitialY

        public static final long station2InitialY
        Default value of y coordinate to insert in Database when deploying the x-Axis marker during Grid Initial Configuration. As it is the Origin its x,y are {distance from origin,0}
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • station1Alpha

        public static final double station1Alpha
        Default value of angle alpha to insert in Database when deploying the Origin during Grid Initial Configuration. As it is the Origin and Alpha is the angle any point makes with the x-Axis of the Floe's Coordinate system so for both the Origin and the x-Axis marker Alpha is 0.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • station2Alpha

        public static final double station2Alpha
        Default value of angle alpha to insert in Database when deploying the x-Axis marker during Grid Initial Configuration. As it is the Origin and Alpha is the angle any point makes with the x-Axis of the Floe's Coordinate system so for both the Origin and the x-Axis marker Alpha is 0.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MOBILE_STATION_IS_CALCULATED

        public static final int MOBILE_STATION_IS_CALCULATED
        The value to set of the field isCalculated in the Database table mobileStationTable when AlphaCalculationService calculates the location parameters of the Mobile Station. The GridActivity only displays those Mobile Stations whose isCalculated has been set to this value.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BASESTN1

        public static final int BASESTN1
        The value to insert in the mmsi field of the fixedStationTable in case the Origin station is recovered or is broken.

        When any Fixed Station is recovered its entire row in the fixedStationTable is deleted, however for the Origin and the x-Axis the row cannot be deleted as these stations define the angle beta and the parameters for other stations and waypoints and sample/measurements such as alpha and distance are calculated in reference to these stations. So when the Origin or x-Axis marker is recovered their entries are deleted from the stationListTable, however in the fixedStationTable the MMSI and Station Name are replaced with a predefined number and text respectively. The location data for the stations is then updated only by the PredictionService and since their MMSI is removed from stationListTable, no AIS data from their MMSI will be inserted in fixedStationTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • BASESTN2

        public static final int BASESTN2
        The value to insert in the mmsi field of the fixedStationTable in case the x-Axis marker station is recovered or is broken.

        When any Fixed Station is recovered its entire row in the fixedStationTable is deleted, however for the Origin and the x-Axis the row cannot be deleted as these stations define the angle beta and the parameters for other stations and waypoints and sample/measurements such as alpha and distance are calculated in reference to these stations. So when the Origin or x-Axis marker is recovered their entries are deleted from the stationListTable, however in the fixedStationTable the MMSI and Station Name are replaced with a predefined number and text respectively. The location data for the stations is then updated only by the PredictionService and since their MMSI is removed from stationListTable, no AIS data from their MMSI will be inserted in fixedStationTable.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • deviceNames

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> deviceNames
        List to hold the deviceNames of all the Devices existing in the Database table deviceListTable. This list is used to populate the Device details on the layout of SampleMeasurementActivity, once a deviceShortName has been selected from the AutoCompleteTextView.

      • deviceShortNames

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> deviceShortNames
        List to hold the deviceShortName of all the Devices existing in the Database table deviceListTable. This list is used to provide the drop down list in AutoCompleteTextView on the layout of SampleMeasurementActivity.

      • deviceIDs

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> deviceIDs
        List to hold the deviceID of all the Devices existing in the Database table deviceListTable. This list is used to populate the Device details on the layout of SampleMeasurementActivity, once a deviceShortName has been selected from the AutoCompleteTextView.

      • deviceTypes

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> deviceTypes
        List to hold the deviceType of all the Devices existing in the Database table deviceListTable. This list is used to populate the Device details on the layout of SampleMeasurementActivity, once a deviceShortName has been selected from the AutoCompleteTextView.

      • stationTypes

        public static final java.lang.String[] stationTypes
        String array which provides the values which can be stored in stationType. This array is used to populate the Spinner in the layout of DeploymentActivity. The same array is used for both Static and Fixed Station.

      • configurationParameters

        public static final java.lang.String[] configurationParameters
        String array which provides names of the Configuration Parameters to be stored in the Database table configParametersTable. When the App is installed on a tablet for the first time, the parameterName column of the configParametersTable is populated with this array and default values..

      • MOTHER_SHIP_MMSI

        public static final int MOTHER_SHIP_MMSI
        Constant defining the MMSI of the Mothership which will be shown as a Star on the Mapview. By default this should be the MMSI of Polarstern.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • DatabaseHelper

        public DatabaseHelper(android.content.Context context)
        Default Constructor

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db)
        Default SQLiteOpenHelper.onCreate(SQLiteDatabase). This method is called when the App is installed on a tablet. It creates the Database tables, populates the configParametersTable with default values of each parameterName and creates a default Admin User.
        Specified by:
        onCreate in class android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper

      • onUpgrade

        public void onUpgrade(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db,
                      int oldVersion,
                      int newVersion)
        Default SQLiteOpenHelper.onUpgrade(SQLiteDatabase, int, int) . This method is called when the App is installed on a tablet which already has an older version of this App running. It just clears the data from the earlier tables and creates any new columns or tables which were not a part of the old version of the database.
        Specified by:
        onUpgrade in class android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
        Parameters:
        oldVersion - The DB_VERSION currently running on the App installed.
        newVersion - The DB_VERSION of the updated Database.

      • createTables

        private static void createTables(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db,
                                 int oldVersion,
                                 int newVersion)
        This method sets up the Database schema for the App to run. If this the first installation of the App on a tablet it will create all the tables and define the columns of each table and set up the complete schema. If there is an older version of the App already running on the Tablet. It will just clear the data from most of the tables and add the comment field to the sampleMeasurementTable as it was part of the previous version of this App.

        Please note that it will not clear data from configParametersTable or usersTable but only clear data from those tables which are used for creating and maintaining the Coordinate System.

        Parameters:
        oldVersion - The DB_VERSION currently running on the App installed.
        newVersion - The DB_VERSION of the updated Database.

      • insertUser

        public static void insertUser(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db,
                              java.lang.String name,
                              java.lang.String pass)
        Inserts a User and its specified Password in the Database table usersTable. Used to create a new Admin User.
        Parameters:
        name - userName of the new User.
        pass - password of the new User.

      • insertDefaultConfigParams

        private static void insertDefaultConfigParams(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db,
                                              java.lang.String name,
                                              java.lang.String value)
        Inserts a new Configuration Parameter and its value in the Database table configParametersTable. This is used when the App is installed on the tablet and configParametersTable needs to be populated with default values.
        Parameters:
        name - parameterName of the Configuration Parameter.
        value - parameterValue of the Configuration Parameter.

      • insertDeviceList

        private static void insertDeviceList(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db)
        Only for debugging purpose

      • searchPassword

        public java.lang.String searchPassword(java.lang.String uname,
                                       android.content.Context context)
        Given a userName this method will search the usersTable to check if the user exists and if it exists it will return the password of that User. This is used by LoginPage to validate the Admin User and this is also used to check for replications when creating a new User.
        Parameters:
        uname - userName of the User
        context - The Context in which the App is running.
        Returns:
        The password for the given userName.

      • getDbInstance

        public static DatabaseHelper getDbInstance(android.content.Context context)
        Creates an instance of DatabaseHelper. This ensures that the only one Activity or Service is accessing the Database at a time and prevents concurrent read or write operations.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context in which the App is running.
        Returns:
        A DatabaseHelper object.

      • loadDeviceList

        public static void loadDeviceList(android.content.Context mContext)
        Loads the Device data from the Database table deviceListTable and populates each column in their respective List. This method is called by the SampleMeasurementActivity to load the Device data when take a Sample/Measurement
        Parameters:
        mContext - The Context in which the App is running.

      • advancedSearchTextView

        public static android.widget.ArrayAdapter<java.lang.String> advancedSearchTextView(android.content.Context mContext)
        Creates an ArrayAdapter which is attached to the List of deviceShortNames.
        Parameters:
        mContext - The Context in which the App is running.
        Returns:
        An ArrayAdapter of type String which is attached to deviceShortNames.

      • getDeviceAttributes

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getDeviceAttributes(java.lang.String devShortName)
        When a deviceShortName is selected by the User in the AutoCompleteTextView on the layout of the SampleMeasurementActivity, the other attributes of the same device need to be Auto filled in the layout. This method returns the rest of the device attributes given its Short name in an ArrayList which can then be used to populate the rest of the fields on the Layout.
        Parameters:
        devShortName - deviceShortName of the Device selected from AutoCompleteTextView.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing the deviceID, deviceName, deviceType for the given deviceShortName.

      • readCoordinateDisplaySetting

        public static boolean readCoordinateDisplaySetting(android.content.Context context)
        This method reads the configParametersTable to read the current value of the parameter lat_long_view_format. The value stored in the table is either 0 (display format will be Degree Minutes' Seconds'' Direction) or 1 (Degree.xxx).
        Parameters:
        context - The Context in which the App is running.
        Returns:
        true if display format is Degree Minutes' Seconds'' Direction or false if format is Degree.xxx.

      • readSiginificantDigitsSetting

        public static int readSiginificantDigitsSetting(android.content.Context context)
        This method reads the configParametersTable to read the current value of the parameter decimal_number_significant_figures.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context in which the App is running.
        Returns:
        The number of significant figures to display on the interface of the App.

      • updateCoordinateDisplaySetting

        public static boolean updateCoordinateDisplaySetting(android.content.Context context,
                                                     boolean changeDegFormat)
        This method updates the value of the Configuration Parameter lat_long_view_format.
        Parameters:
        context - The Context in which the App is running.
        changeDegFormat - if true the value stored will 0 (display format will be Degree Minutes' Seconds'' Direction) else the value stored will be 1 (display format will be Degree.xxx).
        Returns:
        true if the value is updated successfully.
